name: grandiosely
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that contains more detail than necessary, or that is intended to make something seem larger or more important: He rather grandiosely suggests his own interpretation of why the novel has continued to move readers. This is the second contest in the grandiosely named Triple Crown event. Related word
grandiose
More examplesFewer examplesThe author somewhat grandiosely proclaims that this is "the true story". What is grandiosely referred to as "research" simply involves reading other people's ideas and taking notes.He grandiosely called this handful of young soldiers a liberation army.He waved grandiosely.
